page.title: 16HOMES - PAST, PRESENT-FUTURE
page.content: Until 1980 the area had changed very little since the population increase of the 1930's and 1940's. Elmdon Heath was developed with 3 bedroomed semi detached homes. Up market properties were built along part of the Hampton Lane. The 1960's led to infilling of housing on the Damson Wood area. The greater part of the area changed very little, with Catherine de Barnes having a small settlement. With the construction of the Damson Parkway, on the edge of the present Green Belt, in 1980, a great deal of change is taking place. The land adjacent to Hampton Coppice has been developed. A large council estate offering a mixture of semi detached, maisonettes and old peoples accommodation. The bulk of the land is being covered by large, detached, luxury, private housing.
